captions.text:
Welcome to howtocookthat.net. I'm Ann Reardon.
For a printable copy of any of the recipes
simply go to the website howtocookthat.net.

Today we're looking at how to pipe these beautiful
buttercream flowers using only a Ziploc bag.

No piping tips needed, just a bag and a pair
of scissors.

We're going to start with these ones. What
you need to do is make a small triangular

cut out of the bag. I'll show you on an envelope
so that you can see more clearly the cut that's

needed. So, you take that little corner out
then fill your bag with buttercream. If you

want your flowers to have multiple colors
just add two colors of buttercream at once

to your bag and then push it down so that
both are heading towards the opening. Twist

it shut and then hold it so that the side
which has the pointed bit of plastic is on

top and then just squeeze and pullback all
around your cupcake. Then continue to do that

all the way around. Obviously if you want
darker colors, just add more coloring into

your buttercream before you do it. I wanted
a quite a neutral creamy pinkie tone to this

one. Keep going around and then just put a
couple one or two more in the middle.

Next, we are going to look at the camellias.
To do that, you need to do a slightly different

cut. Fold over a corner of your bag and then
cut towards the corner but not all the way

through. Again I'll show you that on a piece
of paper so that you can see exactly what

I've done there. So fold the corner of your
bag over and then just make a slit in the

middle towards the corner but not the whole
way through. Next you need to add a base color

if you want to you can use just your buttercream
or if you want a smooth base color use the

other recipe that's on the blog post there's
a link in the description below the video

to get a smooth finish or you can just use
your buttercream as your base. Then choose

a different color for your flowers and put
it in your piping bag. Then, squeeze. Lift

up. Squeeze. Stop. Lift up. Squeeze. Stop.
Lift up and each time twisting the cupcake

slightly so that the icing lands in a different
place. I'll show you that again. Squeeze.

Stop. Lift up. Turn. Squeeze. Stop. Lift up.
Turn. Squeeze. Stop. Lift up. Turn. And you

can make your flowers as big or as small as
you want. Camellia's are quite a messy so

just swirl it around keep going and give a
little twist at the end. Finally, the rose
buds here are super quick and easy to make.

Again fold your bag over and using your scissors,
cut towards the point but not the whole way

through just like you did for the camellias.
Next what you need to do is open up your bag

and turn the bag and flatten it so that you're
doing the opposite part of the corner. And

then make the same cut again. It's a bit hard
to see on the bags. So I'll show you again

on the paper so that you can see exactly what
we've done. So fold it just like we did before

and cut towards the corner but not the whole
way through. Open it up. Open up your bag.

Flatten it out. Then fold that over and exactly
the same that you did before cut toward the

corner try to make these cuts about the same
size. So to do that you need to fold it over

about the same size at each time. Take the
cup cake. And then twist as far round as you

can and then turn back and twist back the
other way a couple of times. And there you

have your rose bud super quick. So just twist.
I like to twist my hand as far as I can the

other way before I start so I can turn it
the whole way around. And there you have a

rose bud super quick and super easy. If you've
got a lot of cupcakes to do, this makes that

process very quick and simple. If you want
to make them sparkle if it's for a birthday

party or a wedding, just add a little bit
of edible glitter over the top. This is available
in most cake decorating stores.

Thank you for watching the video. Thank you
to all those subscribers and people who've

left comments and clicked like. I really appreciate
your support. If you watch the next video,

I'll show you how to do the leaves out of
butter cream also just using a Ziploc bag
and a three other types of flowers.

title: Ann's NEW easy buttercream roses flower cupcakes pt1 how to cook that ann reardon

comments.text:
@Moviedeeva, a ratio you can use is: 1tbls of meringue powder (egg white 
substitute) per 1lb of confectioner's sugar. Be careful not to use too much 
meringue powder as it will alter the flavor of your icing. You could also 
use half shortening and half butter (per your recipe)- you still would want 
to use a stabilizer. Let me know if I can be of further help. ﻿
